page.title: 06Staplehurst C.P.School.
page.content: The present primary school is housed in three buildings on two sites. A 112 year old school is separated from two new buildings by the main road.In 1963 a new school was built for the upper juniors and infants to use and later in 1971 an infant school was completed There are 18 classes with approximate- ly 30 children in each making a some 540 children in all. The 1873 school was built in three separate parts,for infants,boys and girls.The boys were separated from the girls by a fence and if they were caught passing notes or climbing over it they were severely punished. Even now some rooms can only be reached from others by going outside. There are some roads named after previous headmasters and mistresses, such as Pope Drive,Reeves Close,Oliver Road and Gibbon Rise.
